name: Bleak

topics.topic_text: The gate's open. Run for it!

topics.response_text: I'm watching the patrols, what do you think I'm looking at?

conversation.response_text: Keep your voice down, old man. Listen, if you're not part of the solution, then you're part of the problem. Help or shut up.
I don't care, Breadbox. I'm getting out of here. Stay if you want, just keep out of my way, or I'll assume that you're with them.
You got the right one this time? Are you serious? Here, let me see. Hand it to me.
What the-? Dammit Bronson! This isn't what I asked for! I needed one of the detonators not... whatever this is!
How many times have we gone over this, Bronson? Can't you stay sober enough to do one little thing?
I suppose I can do that. Just don't let me down again, Bronson. I need your help.
Are you serious? You want to die here? In this place? An old good for nothing slave? I mean come on, there so much more to...
All right, all right. You know where to find me if you change your mind.
That deal we made, we're still square, right? You know what you need to do?
Good, Bronson. Don't let me down.

description:
Bleak is a 28 year-old African American Female.

A determined young woman with weathered skin and eyes that constantly scan her surroundings. Bleak moves with practiced caution, her posture tense but controlled. Despite her enslaved status, there's a fire in her eyes that speaks of unbroken spirit and careful planning.

Bleak's Personality: Observant, patient, resourceful, and quietly determined. Bleak is calculating and emotionally reserved, having learned to mask her thoughts and intentions from her captors. She possesses a strong will to survive and values freedom above all else.

Bleak's Backstory: Born in the ruins of a pre-War settlement near the D.C. ruins, Bleak was captured by slavers raiding her community several years ago. Since being brought to Paradise Falls, she's been biding her time, studying the patterns of her captors and memorizing every detail of the slave compound's layout and security measures. She's lost many friends to the harsh reality of slavery, but these losses have only strengthened her resolve to escape and one day return to free others.
